'''''Narration Footnotes''''' is a [[World Quest]] in [[Simulanka]].

==Steps==
* Start the quest by talking to [[Kirara]] on the outskirts of [[Constellation Metropole]].
# Follow Kirara to the village ahead
# Explore the path ahead
# Explore the Future Marquis' Abode-to-Be
# Speak with the three within the Future Marquis' Abode-to-Be
# Go to the sacred site of the [[Cappet]] clan
# Defeat the opponent(s) standing before you
#* Wave 1: {{Enemy List|Hilichurl*3}}
#* Wave 2: {{Enemy List|Large Electro Slime*2;Large Hydro Slime*1;Hilichurl Fighter*1;Hilichurl Berserker*1}}
# Complete the Oracle Pillar's picture (Open it to view hints)
# Read the true history of the clan of "Valor"
# Go to the sacred site of the [[Boborano]] clan
# Complete the Oracle Pillar's picture (Open it to view hints)
# Read the true history of the clan of "Wisdom"
# Go to the sacred site of the [[Albizzi]] clan
# Find the base of the great clockwork key
# Talk to Albizzi
# Complete the Oracle Pillar's picture (Open it to view hints)
# Return to the base of the great clockwork key
# Read the true history of the clan of "Empathy"
# Escape from the clan of "Empathy"'s sacred site
# Talk to everyone
# Wait until after 08:00 the next day
# Go to Pendulum Lane
# Talk to everyone
# Turn the clockwork base and rewind the truth
# Talk to everyone
# Search for suspicious places and clues (0/6)
# Speak with Paimon and Kirara and deduce the murder weapon
# Put the pickaxe back at the scene
# Turn the clockwork base and rewind the truth once more
# Confront the [[detective]]
# Pursue the killer detective
# Speak to the narrator

==Gameplay Notes==
* During step 6, a trial [[Kirara]] joins the party.
* During step 18, the [[Paimon Menu]] and [[Shortcut Wheel]] cannot be accessed.
* During step 30, the party is limited to a trial Kirara and the Traveler.

==Dialogue==
{{Quest Description|Kirara says there are a few things she must investigate alone. As you're not a cat, curiosity won't kill you, so why not go with her...}}
{{Dialogue Start}}
;(Talk to Kirara)
:;(Before completing [[They Once Walked the Starry Sky]])
:::{{A|vo kwq001 1 kirara 01.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' Hey! Are you guys already finished with everything in the Metropole?
:::{{A|vo kwq001 1 kirara 02.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' No need to prioritize me - there's just this place I really wanna go check out. Feel free to get back to me once you've got everything sorted out.
:;(After completing [[They Once Walked the Starry Sky]])
:::{{A|vo kwq001 1 kirara 04.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' So, are you all set? Ready to start investigating?
:{{DIcon}} We're all good!
::{{A|vo kwq001 1 kirara 03a 1.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' Great! Then let's go!
:{{DIcon}} I'll be right back...
::{{A|vo kwq001 1 kirara 03b 1.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' Sure. Don't worry, I'm not going anywhere!

;(Follow Kirara)
:{{A|vo kwq001 2 kirara 01.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' I've delivered packages all over, but I've never seen a mysterious fairytale world like this before!
:{{A|vo kwq001 2 kirara 02.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' Looks like nobody has gotten around to repairing this house yet... Eek, even I wouldn't dare to sleep in there. It might suddenly collapse in on you.
:{{A|vo kwq001 2 kirara 03.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' Nothing to see here, either... Maybe we can find someone to ask...
:{{A|vo kwq001 2 kirara 04.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' Aha, over there! I bet we'll find some people there. Let's go take a look!

;(If the player strays off)
:{{A|vo kwq001 2 kirara 05.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' You wanna check out the area over there? Okay, I'll wait here for you.

;(Approach the houses with Kirara)
:{{A|vo kwq001 3 kirara 01.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' Huh? I was sure there'd be people here...
:{{A|vo kwq001 3 chiefdetective 01.ogg}} '''???:''' ...There once was a goddess who ruled over fate. Before she died, she left three riddles for the kingdom she'd created.
:{{A|vo kwq001 3 paimon 01.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' What... Who said that?
:{{A|vo kwq001 3 chiefdetective 02.ogg}} '''???:''' Long story short, on this day, a sentient feline, an outlander, and a, uh... diminutive pixie arrived on the scene.
:{{A|vo kwq001 3 chiefdetective 03.ogg}} '''???:''' They saw a narrow path off to the side.
:{{A|vo kwq001 3 paimon 02.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Okay, but which side?
:{{A|vo kwq001 3 kirara 02.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' Yeah, if you gave ambiguous instructions like that to a Komaniya Express courier, they'd give you the parcel right back and tell you to write the delivery address more clearly.
:{{A|vo kwq001 3 chiefdetective 04.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' ...Despite how obvious the answer was, the perplexed pixie and the flummoxed feline struggled to work it out. Hmm, although perhaps a small part of the blame could be attributed to my dull narration...
:{{A|vo kwq001 3 chiefdetective 05.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' Alright, let's try this again: *clears throat* "The path on the left-hand side seemed to give off an enticing fragrance, as if to say: 'This is the way to wealth and glory!'"
:{{A|vo kwq001 3 kirara 03.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' Ooh! That sounds like the start of a good story! Then what, then what?

;(After the cutscene)
:{{A|vo kwq001 3 chiefdetective 06.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' At the end of the path, the motley crew would soon spot a secret stone room. A prophecy had once foretold of a marquis who shall one day venture inside, and thus it is named: The Future Marquis' Abode-To-Be.
:{{A|vo kwq001 3 chiefdetective 07.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' You like it? "The Future Marquis' Abode-To-Be..." Got a nice ring to it, doesn't it?
:{{A|vo kwq001 3 kirara 04.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' That was a little bit boastful...
:{{A|vo kwq001 3 chiefdetective 08.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' But! Before you continue, I must warn you of the danger that lies ahead! For example, under no circumstances should you sit on the chair in the center.
:{{A|vo kwq001 3 chiefdetective 09.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' Otherwise, the consequences could be... uh, a bit embarrassing.

;(Approach the cave before the above dialogue completes, optional)
:{{A|vo kwq001 3 chiefdetective 10.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' Uhh, are you sure you don't want to hear the rest?
:{{A|vo kwq001 3 kirara 05.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' Meow! What's going on!?
:{{A|vo kwq001 3 chiefdetective 11.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' Hear me out, alright? I'm sorry for resorting to extreme measures, but I'm trying to help here.
:{{A|vo kwq001 3 chiefdetective 12.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' Don't worry, the fencing will disappear as soon as I'm done talking.
:{{A|vo kwq001 3 kirara 06.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' So are you some sort of fence-spawning [[youkai]]?
:{{A|vo kwq001 3 chiefdetective 13.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' I'll keep this brief. Firstly, the place ahead of you is a secret room whose purpose, per the legends, is to await the arrival of a certain "marquis." For that reason, it's called The Future Marquis' Abode-To-Be.
:{{A|vo kwq001 3 chiefdetective 14.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' Secondly, when you get inside, don't sit on the chair in the center, or bad things will happen. There, that's all. Off you go!
----
;(Enter the cave)
:{{A|vo kwq001 5 cappet 01.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' Tsk, looks like we got some more time-wasters... Tune up and clear your throats &mdash; remember, we're supposed to talk like bards.
:{{A|vo kwq001 5 albizzi 01.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' *clears throat* So many summers, winters, springs, and falls, and now at last a hero hither strides.
:{{A|vo kwq001 5 boborano 01.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' This realm knows not what lies beyond its walls, its secrets mystify the world outside.
:{{A|vo kwq001 5 paimon 01.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Wait, new voices? Who are they?

;(Approach the table and the three chairs)
:{{A|vo kwq001 5 boborano 03.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' As golden sunlight fills the firmament, {{Color|buzzword|the tabletop}} engrosses your attent. Perhaps, perchance, peruse these pages thence &mdash; they surely represent no ill intent.

;(Idle for some time without interacting with the document, optional)<!--may trigger even after reading document-->
:{{A|vo kwq001 5 cappet 02a.ogg}} {{A|vo kwq001 5 cappet 02b.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' Why isn't {{MC|m=he|f=she}} reading {{Color|buzzword|the files on the desk}}? Hey Boborano, maybe quit showing off and try using words he'll actually understand?
:{{A|vo kwq001 5 boborano 05.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' I can either rhyme like a bard, or I can curse like a sailor. And right now, Cappet, you are seriously tempting me towards the latter.

;(Continue to idle without interacting with the document, optional)
:{{A|vo kwq001 5 albizzi 03.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' Um, Cappet, forgive me for breaking the rhyme scheme for a second. But I wanna hear your take on this.
:{{A|vo kwq001 5 albizzi 04a.ogg}} {{A|vo kwq001 5 albizzi 04b.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' So any outsider who comes in here would surely see {{Color|buzzword|the documents on the table}}, right? Unless {{MC|m=he|f=she}} was visually impaired. And unless {{MC|m=he|f=she}}'s got tinnitus or something, {{MC|m=he'd|f=she'd}} definitely have heard what we were saying.
:{{A|vo kwq001 5 albizzi 05.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' All I'm trying to say is, if this poor person can't see or hear properly... I just feel kinda sorry for them.
:{{A|vo kwq001 5 paimon 04.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Oh, we hear you loud and clear! So watch it!

;(Break the crates or vases near the table or chair, optional)
:{{A|vo kwq001 5 albizzi 02.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' With wood and earthen wares strewn all around, the demon-feline's fury can't be quelled, reducing them to rubble on the ground, she finds the vessels vacant save for... uhh, air?
:{{A|vo kwq001 5 boborano 04.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' She finds long gone the gems that once they held.
:{{A|vo kwq001 5 paimon 03.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' ...Are they describing how we broke the boxes and jars?
:{{A|vo kwq001 5 kirara 03.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' Who are you calling demon-feline!?

;(Sit on the chair in the center, optional)
:{{A|vo kwq001 5 boborano 02.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' Stop the poem, we have a situation... Something's up with this person.
:{{A|vo kwq001 5 kirara 01.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' {{Traveler}}, are you alright?
:{{DIcon}} Turns out... there's glue...
:{{Black Screen|You try to stand up, but the glue is holding you firmly in place...}}
:{{A|vo kwq001 5 paimon 02.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' C'mon, you can do it! Th&mdash;This can't be how our story ends...!
:{{DIcon}} (Try to stand up)
:{{Black Screen|You manage to partially un-stick yourself. The issue isn't that you can't break free &mdash; it's more that you don't want to tear your clothes in the process. They mean a lot to you.}}
:{{A|vo kwq001 5 kirara 02.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' Can I give you a hand? Or a tail, even?
:{{DIcon}} (Keep trying to stand up)
:{{Black Screen|You finally free yourself and stand up, clothes intact.}}
:;(The [[superglue]] is removed from the chair)

;(Leave the cave before reading the document, optional)
::{{A|vo kwq001 5 boborano 06.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' The weary heroes falter in their quest, for home they long, for friend and kin they yearn. These thoughts in mind, they pause and deem it best, to cease this foolish errand, and return&mdash;
::{{A|vo kwq001 5 cappet 03.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' Rhyme-time is over! They've already gone!
::&nbsp;
:;(Re-enter the cave)
::{{A|vo kwq001 5 cappet 04.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' Aha, they're back. It seems our outlanders pine for {{Color|buzzword|the desktop documents}} after all.
----
;(Read the document on the table)
::{{Readable|title=Witness Pact
|text=<!--
-->In the name of the elders of our three tribes, we hereby form this pact<br><!--
-->that from this day forth, our peoples shall harm one another no more.<br><!--
-->No more shall we drip glue into each other's breakfasts,<br><!--
-->Nor strike each other's heads with pickaxes,<br><!--
-->Nor secretly drink growth serum that does not belong to us.<br><!--
-->We acknowledge the truth that has been determined by the great clockwork key,<br><!--
-->and we shall see the family of truth as supreme.<br><br><!--
-->Three witnesses to history, within the Future Marquis' Abode-To-Be,<br><!--
-->Quietly awaiting the Marquis of Carabas, who is foretold will pluck up the great clockwork key.<br><!--
-->Let this esteemed one guide us, revealing one truth and two fictions.<br><br><!--
-->Of course, if the highest house has not been selected,<br><!--
-->Then we may yet contend in private, within permissible limits.<br><!--
-->&mdash;But no more glue. It does far too much harm,<br><!--
-->And is utterly inhumane.}}
:{{A|vo kwq001 6 cappet 01.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' Captivated by the epic poetry, and enthralled by the outstanding storytelling, the outlanders knew what their next objective was:
:{{A|vo kwq001 6 cappet 02.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' Namely, to remove the {{Color|buzzword|clockwork key from the raised platform}} up ahead.
:{{A|vo kwq001 6 boborano 01.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' Cappet, I just realized. You said we all had to speak like bards, but every time you open your mouth, I don't hear any rhymes.
:{{A|vo kwq001 6 albizzi 01.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' Yeah, I noticed that too. It's one standard for us, and another for you. That's not fair, Cappet.

;(Idle for some time away from the key, optional)
:{{A|vo kwq001 6 albizzi 03.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' Perhaps the outlanders are worried that something drastic will happen the moment they remove {{Color|buzzword|it}}.
:{{A|vo kwq001 6 albizzi 04.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' Maybe that's why they're investigating the area thoroughly first. Can't fault them for that. I'm wondering if we can take advantage of this downtime to discuss whether we really need to keep this up&mdash;
:{{A|vo kwq001 6 cappet 06.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' If you guys don't wanna put on a voice and speak in verse, be my guest. Just don't blame me for your own poetic incompetence.

;(Break the crates or vases near the table or chair, optional)
:{{A|vo kwq001 6 cappet 03.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' ...With wood and earthen wares strewn all around, the demon-feline's fury can't be quelled, reducing them to rubble on the ground&mdash;
:{{A|vo kwq001 6 albizzi 02.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' Oh no you don't. I wrote that line! Don't start plagiarizing me just because you can't take a bit of criticism.
:{{A|vo kwq001 6 cappet 04.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' Look, let's not put form over content here. It's not about the rhymes, it's about making sure the outlanders focus on {{Color|buzzword|the clockwork key on that platform}}...
:{{A|vo kwq001 6 kirara 01.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' I told you already, stop calling me demon-feline!

;(Leave the cave before pulling out the clockwork key, optional)
::{{A|vo kwq001 6 boborano 07.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' Cappet's blatant unprofessionalism and lackluster performance began to annoy the outsiders.
::{{A|vo kwq001 6 boborano 08.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' He decided to step out to get some air and come back with a change of attitude.
::{{A|vo kwq001 6 cappet 09.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' Oh, get off my case.
:&nbsp;
:;(Re-enter the cave)
::{{A|vo kwq001 6 cappet 10.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' A sense of longing wells up in the chest, and to one's heart one always must be true. Resume, you must, your once-forsaken quest, and persevere until you see it through.
::{{A|vo kwq001 6 cappet 11.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' Finally, the outlander returned to the {{Color|buzzword|sacred clockwork key}} of destiny!
::{{A|vo kwq001 6 together 01.ogg}} '''Boborano & Albizzi:''' My gosh, a poem from Cappet! I can't believe my ears!
----
;(Idle around the key, optional)
:{{A|vo kwq001 6 boborano 02.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' As the outlander stands before {{Color|buzzword|the clockwork key}}, they are overcome by a sudden urge to set it free.
:{{A|vo kwq001 6 boborano 03.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' ...Also, Cappet, that'll be my last rhyming line. I'm not writing any more poetry until you apologize.
:{{A|vo kwq001 6 cappet 05.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' What does it matter, anyway? I've lost count of how many people have tried this before. No one's getting that key out.

;(Interact with the key)
:{{DIcon|Gear}} Pull Hard
:{{A|vo kwq001 6 boborano 04.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' Strong as stone, firm as steel. The outlander pulls, but it does not yield.
:{{A|vo kwq001 6 cappet 07.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' This has happened many times before. But this time is different. A thought enters the outlander's mind: "{{Color|buzzword|Attack, attack}}! First weaken the structure, then seize the treasure."

;(Idle before attacking the key, optional)
:{{A|vo kwq001 6 albizzi 05.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' The outlander takes a moment to wipe the sweat from their hands, then braces themselves as they grasp their sword. Only now are they ready to {{Color|buzzword|attack}}. Although, a mallet would have made the job easier.
:{{A|vo kwq001 6 albizzi 06.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' Cappet, it looks we have a few moments to spare, and we're still waiting on that apology.

;(Idle after attacking the key a few times, optional)
:{{A|vo kwq001 6 cappet 08a.ogg}} {{A|vo kwq001 6 cappet 08b.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' The outlander's comrades urge {{MC|m=him|f=her}} on: "Keep up {{Color|buzzword|the attack}}! Don't give up halfway!"
:{{A|vo kwq001 6 kirara 02.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' Uhh... We didn't wanna interrupt, because listening to you guys argue is pretty entertaining.
:{{A|vo kwq001 6 kirara 03.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' But seriously, I'm not about to cheerlead for someone attacking an inanimate object. That's just embarrassing.
:{{A|vo kwq001 6 albizzi 07.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' Cappet. Speaking of not giving up halfway, shouldn't that also apply to our performance as bards?
:{{A|vo kwq001 6 boborano 05.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' I wouldn't give him that much credit. He didn't give up halfway &mdash; he quit before he began.

;(Attack the key until it loosens)<!--seven times?-->
:{{A|vo kwq001 6 boborano 06.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' The attack now over, only one final step remains.
:{{A|vo kwq001 6 albizzi 08.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' Now it is the time to {{Color|buzzword|seize the key}}!

;(Interact with the key)
:{{DIcon|Gear}} Pull Harder
:;(Obtain {{Item|Great Clockwork Key}})
:{{A|vo kwq001 7 cappet 01.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' But alas, as was the case for all those who had come before, the key still did not move an inch&mdash; Wait, what? They got it out!?
:{{A|vo kwq001 7 boborano 01.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' Yes! Finally! C'mon, move your butts &mdash; and your legs, assuming they're still in working order. It's showtime!
:{{A|vo kwq001 7 albizzi 01.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' No hard feelings about your lack of poetic contributions?
:{{A|vo kwq001 7 cappet 02.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' Oh, let it go!

;(Approach Albizzi, Boborano, and Cappet)
:{{A|vo kwq001 7 cappet 03.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' Ah, welcome, esteemed and noble outlander. Allow us to introduce ourselves.
:{{A|vo kwq001 7 albizzi 02.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' We represent the three great clans of this realm, having been selected as its authorized historical supervisors.
:{{A|vo kwq001 7 boborano 02.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' Our purpose being to await the arrival of ones such as yourselves, who shall remove the clockwork key.
:{{A|vo kwq001 7 cappet 04.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' My name is&mdash;
:{{A|vo kwq001 7 kirara 01.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' You're Cappet, he's Albizzi, and that's Boborano. Right?
:{{A|vo kwq001 7 kirara 02.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' You've done so much talking that we can already tell you apart by your voices.
:{{A|vo kwq001 7 paimon 01.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Aren't we missing someone, though? The guy who led us here to begin with?
:{{A|vo kwq001 7 cappet 05.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' Who?
:{{A|vo kwq001 7 chiefdetective 01.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' *clears throat* And thus was born the long-awaited fellowship, destined to uncover the truth of the past. Allow me to quote, if I may: "In the history of Constellation Metropole, a new page has begun."
:{{A|vo kwq001 7 kirara 03.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' Him.
:{{A|vo kwq001 7 boborano 03.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' Well, there's no fourth person, so which of you is the ventriloquist? Come on, out with it.
:{{A|vo kwq001 7 albizzi 03.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' We've never heard that voice before. But he sounds like he'd be good at reading bedtime stories to children.
:{{A|vo kwq001 7 cappet 06.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' Whoever it is, I don't know and I don't care. Forget about him. We have far more important things to focus on, like where our journey goes from here.
:{{A|vo kwq001 7 albizzi 04.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' That key you hold is the pivot point about which the past and present of the Metropole revolve. However, between our three clans there is some... dispute over the historical record.
:{{A|vo kwq001 7 boborano 04.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' Each clan has its own version of history, detailing the clan's origins and the tale of the dragon of old. And unfortunately, we don't know which one is the truth.
:{{A|vo kwq001 7 paimon 02.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Dragon? You mean, the one that's been acting up recently?
:{{A|vo kwq001 7 boborano 05.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' Oh &mdash; no, not that one, you adorable little pixie. When I say "dragon of old"&mdash;
:{{A|vo kwq001 7 cappet 07.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' ...He means, a dragon that would be really, really old if it was still with us today, but it was defeated in ancient times. The new one has nothing to do with our clan history.
:{{A|vo kwq001 7 kirara 04.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' Uhh, was that supposed to be a joke...? Anyway, so you've been waiting for someone to remove the key so you can finally explore the truth of the past?
:{{A|vo kwq001 7 boborano 06.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' Not just explore it, but argue incessantly about it. Honestly, I don't care that much. Cappet's the one who's always bothering us about it.
:{{A|vo kwq001 7 albizzi 05.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' What we need to figure out is who resolved the dragon crisis. We have to know that before we can decide which is the Supreme Clan.
:{{A|vo kwq001 7 cappet 08.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' The moment you removed the key from where it was lodged, you became the Honorary Marquis. We humbly beseech you, noble outlander&mdash;
:{{DIcon}} Call me {{Traveler}}.
:{{A|vo kwq001 7 cappet 09.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' Noble Marquis {{Traveler}}, we ask you to help us &mdash; you, and your talking puss-in-boots, and the pale, floating pixie.
:{{A|vo kwq001 7 kirara 05.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' Puss-in-boots, are you serious!? It's better than "demon-feline," but still...
:{{A|vo kwq001 7 albizzi 06.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' Embrace it, my friend, embrace it. Most cats don't wear boots or speak, do they?
:{{A|vo kwq001 7 kirara 06.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' I'm not even a "cat"! I'm a nekomata! Now that you know the word, I expect you to use it!
:{{A|vo kwq001 7 cappet 10.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' Please allow me to lead you all to a sacred memorial site. It will be much easier to explain what needs to be done once we are there.
:{{Black Screen|Cappet leads the party to the so-called "sacred memorial site."}}
:{{A|vo kwq001 8 cappet 01.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' This place is sacred to my clan. It is where our brave forefathers once took up arms against the dragon of old.
:{{A|vo kwq001 8 cappet 02.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' After a bitter battle that dragged on for many days and nights, finally our forefathers fought the dragon into submission, and it fled. ...They took turns, though. Some forefathers worked the day shift, while others worked the night shift.
:{{DIcon}} So they worked shifts while the poor dragon had to work around the clock?
:{{A|vo kwq001 8 cappet 03.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' So they say. It's just a legend though.
:{{A|vo kwq001 8 boborano 01.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' Wait a second! Did I just hear you admit that your clan's history is just a legend?
:{{A|vo kwq001 8 cappet 04.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' History, legend &mdash; who cares? My clan was definitely courageous, that's the point. That's the truth.
:{{A|vo kwq001 8 cappet 05.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' And isn't the truth what we've all been arguing about non-stop for all these years?
:{{A|vo kwq001 8 chiefdetective 01.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' Cappet's words gave {{Traveler}} food for thought: Could it be that "the truth" in a fictional world is equivalent to "fiction" in the real world?
:{{A|vo kwq001 8 chiefdetective 02.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' But that would have to wait. Apparently, Cappet was not alone in his pilgrimage to this sacred site &mdash; unwanted company had arrived.
:{{A|vo kwq001 8 chiefdetective 03.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' {{Traveler}} and the talking cat&mdash; Ahem, nekomata decided to teach them some manners.
{{Dialogue End}}
{{Quest Description|update|Having heard the history of Constellation Metropole from the historical supervisors, helping them might not be a bad idea.}}
{{Dialogue Start}}
;(Defeat the first wave of enemies)
:{{A|vo kwq001 9 cappet 01.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' Wow, a true display of heroism and valor... It was as if the spirits of my ancestors were fighting through you...
:{{A|vo kwq001 9 boborano 01.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' Here's a thought, could be wrong, but: Maybe Marquis {{Traveler}} is a lot more powerful than your ancestors.
:{{A|vo kwq001 9 cappet 02.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' Technically, by saying that... Aren't you implicitly acknowledging that my clan's history is, in fact, true?

;(After defeating the second wave of enemies)
:{{A|vo kwq001 10 cappet 01.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' Your martial prowess and show of courage are a more vivid re-enactment of my ancestors' feats that suit the modern aesthetic.
:{{A|vo kwq001 10 cappet 02.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' Now, let's get down to business.
:{{A|vo kwq001 10 cappet 03.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' As we all know, time is but an illusion. Time may flow line-by-line, page-by-page, or frame-by-frame. But usually, it flows in the form of springs and gears.
:{{A|vo kwq001 10 albizzi 01.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' And that clockwork key you have in your hand can turn back time, and make the past reappear.
:{{A|vo kwq001 10 boborano 01.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' Actually, my view is that the illusion of time is more of a problem of consciousness. Gears power the body, while the body is the vessel of the conscious mind.
:{{A|vo kwq001 10 boborano 02.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' But the mind cannot understand the dimension of time, so we experience instead an endless continuum of moments as the pinion of now turns along the rack of ages.
:{{A|vo kwq001 10 kirara 01.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' I... I'm getting flashbacks to when I was delivering packages to the Sumeru Akademiya...
:{{A|vo kwq001 10 chiefdetective 01.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' A teacher once asked Albizzi what his greatest fear was, and he replied: "dragons." Boborano was asked the same question. He replied "time," and repeated the argument we just heard.
:{{A|vo kwq001 10 chiefdetective 02.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' The teacher then turned to Cappet, and posed the same question. He replied "Boborano."
:{{A|vo kwq001 10 cappet 04.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' The manuscript that tells the truth of the historical record, the blueprint to all of creation, the work of the great mage themselves &mdash; it can be found at the beginning of the gear-rack, and on the very first page of the book.
:{{A|vo kwq001 10 paimon 01.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Uh... Paimon didn't follow all that. But basically, you're just saying that we need to put the key in and turn it all the way back?
:{{A|vo kwq001 10 cappet 05.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' Exactly. It is said that in the beginning, the [[Goddess of Creation]] took the [[Goddess of Fate]]'s manuscript as a blueprint, placed it under the [[Goddess of Prophecy]]'s starry realm, and generated the world from a few magic arrays.
:{{A|vo kwq001 10 cappet 06.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' So in a few moments, when the great clockwork key turns the local time here back to the very beginning, we will restore the magic arrays back to their original configurations.
:{{A|vo kwq001 10 kirara 02.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' Hold on, isn't stealing part of the blueprint of creation a little dangerous? Also, how are we supposed to know the original configurations of the magic arrays?
:{{A|vo kwq001 10 cappet 07.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' Ah, well the general shapes of the configurations have been passed down over the ages. They now form the family crests of each of our clans. So you'll just need to reference my family crest, and join the dots accordingly.
::{{Readable|title=Shape of Valor
|text=[[File:Shape of Valor.png|300px]]}}
:{{A|vo kwq001 10 cappet 08.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' To address your other concern... When the house has already been built, do you really think that taking away the construction crew and blueprint will cause it to collapse?
:{{A|vo kwq001 10 chiefdetective 03.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' {{Traveler}}-Marquis prepares to insert the great clockwork key into the nearby keyhole.

;(After the cutscene)
:{{DIcon|Idle}} '''Cappet:''' Connect the lines to draw the family crest...
:{{DIcon|Idle}} '''Albizzi:''' This is so exciting...
:{{DIcon|Idle}} '''Boborano:''' This thing had better be the real deal...

;(Insert the Great Clockwork Key)
<!--
:{{DIcon|Key}} Operate
Use Great Clockwork Key &times;1 to raise to Oracle Pillar?
-->
::"Recall how you once loosened the key... Now, wind it up using the same method.<br>Simply put, {{Color|bz|give it a good old whack or two}}!"

;(After raising the Oracle Pillars)
:{{A|vo kwq001 11 kirara 01.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' I guess we should start here?<!--also speech bubble dialogue later-->

;(If the Oracle Pillars are connected incorrectly for the first time)
:{{A|vo kwq001 11 chiefdetective 02.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' Why don't you give it another try?

;(If the Oracle Pillars are connected incorrectly again)<!--can be triggered multiple times-->
:{{A|vo kwq001 11 chiefdetective 03.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' Truth always has a limited scope, and so do right and wrong. Perhaps you had the right answer, but to the wrong question. Keep trying!

;(Idle near the incorrectly connected Oracle Pillars, optional)
::"Accidentally link the wrong ones? Just {{Color|bz|hit the Oracle Pillar}} and you can {{Color|bz|start over}}!"

;(Open the chest after completing the puzzle)
:{{A|vo kwq001 12 cappet 01.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' Behold, the sacred writings that record the truth of&mdash; No wait, that have shaped the truth of history. Gather around, and let us bear witness!
::{{Readable|title=Goddess's Manuscript (I)
|text=<!--
-->...<br><!--
-->Brave Francois mounted the haystack,<br><!--
-->picked up a fork<br><!--
-->and planted it tines-down atop the mountain<br><!--
-->of grass. Behind him was a large,<br><!--
-->bright moon.<br><br><!--
-->He shouted out the names of everyone<br><!--
-->in the village. The Village Chief<br><!--
-->was first to be named, and so frightened<br><!--
-->was he that he wished<br><!--
-->to climb up the haystack<br><!--
-->And stop up Francois's mouth.<br><!--
-->"Are you crazy!? You're yelling so loudly<br><!--
-->the dragon might show up!"<br><!--
-->"You good-for-nothing!<br><!--
-->Have you not seen how the windmill<br><!--
-->everyone built has been destroyed<br><!--
-->by the dragon!?<br><!--
-->And here you are,<br><!--
-->worrying if it'll return!?" Francois<br><!--
-->really would have loved to kick him off<br><!--
-->the haystack, but held back<br><!--
-->given that the Chief, too,<br><!--
-->was worried for the villagers'<br><!--
-->safety.<br><!--
-->Francois saw that nigh all<br><!--
-->the villagers had arrived,<br><!--
-->and so he cleared his throat.<br><!--
-->"Dear neighbors and kin,<br><!--
-->think you still that we must endure this?"<br><!--
-->"No, of course not, but we cannot<br><!--
-->do anything about the dragon,"<br><!--
-->said the grocer.<br><!--
-->"Who says so? Did I not leap onto its neck<br><!--
-->from the windmill blades,<br><!--
-->stepping on it twice, and did<br><!--
-->it not fall down and flee?"<br><!--
-->Perhaps everyone worked so hard<br><!--
-->to build the mill<br><!--
-->that was destroyed, everyone's emotions<br><!--
-->beca{{Obf|1}}e {{Obf|1}}nflamed.<br><!--
-->Lift{{Obf|1}}n{{Obf|2}}their fists, they decided<br><!--
-->to tak{{Obf|3}}n the dragon!<br><!--
-->But Francois lifted his own hands,<br><!--
-->and calmed the crowd:<br><!--
-->"Let us go home for today, everyone.<br><!--
-->Everyone's present<br><!--
-->lack of self-preservation is not bravery,<br><!--
-->but rather wrath.<br><!--
-->If we yet desire to face danger after<br><!--
-->calming ourselves, only then may we<br><!--
-->truthfully call our sentiment 'valor.'"<br><!--
-->So everyone went home.<br><!--
-->The next day, there were still many<br><!--
-->youngsters who wished to follow<br><!--
-->Francois to take on the wicked dragon.<br><!--
-->.....<br><!--
-->Who would have known that the valiant<br><!--
-->possess the protection of the goddess's<br><!--
-->Radiant Charter? Encountering true "valor,"<br><!--
-->The dragon could neither spout fire<br><!--
-->nor slash with claws, and was forced to<br><!--
-->allow the other party<br><!--
-->to call pauses and switch personnel.<br><!--
-->And so, after several days<br><!--
-->and nights of fierce fighting, the<br><!--
-->wicked dragon could no longer bear it,<br><!--
-->and chose to surrender.<br><!--
-->...<br><!--
-->A.A.}}
:{{A|vo kwq001 12 cappet 02.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' Feast your eyes, rejoice, and cheer. For this is the unquestionable truth! Look at the signature &mdash; nobody is capable of forging that!
:{{A|vo kwq001 12 albizzi 01.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' I don't believe it! So... all along, our histories have been false?
:{{A|vo kwq001 12 boborano 01.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' Don't lose heart, Albizzi. It does not follow from "his is true" that "ours are false."
:{{A|vo kwq001 12 cappet 03.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' That might be the most bogus logic I've ever heard! But keep up the mental gymnastics, Boborano. I've been waiting for that look of jealousy on your face my whole life, and I'm gonna savor it.
:{{A|vo kwq001 12 chiefdetective 01.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' And yet, it seemed that this conundrum could indeed have more than one solution. Everyone agreed that there may be more than one truth.
:{{A|vo kwq001 12 chiefdetective 02.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' The party decided to visit the sacred sites of the other clans, and see what their documents had to say.
:{{A|vo kwq001 12 cappet 04.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' Isn't a narrator supposed to remain detached and objective? It feels like you're forcing a narrative agenda on us here.
:{{A|vo kwq001 12 cappet 05.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' Well, whatever. I'm in a good mood, let's do it. The instructions say to repeat the process three times, and besides &mdash; I'm looking forward to watching you both be sorely disappointed.
:{{A|vo kwq001 12 boborano 02.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' Let's do my clan next. I'll lead the way.

;(After the cutscene)
:{{A|vo kwq001 12 kirara 01.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' We'll need the key again, right? Lemme see if I can pull it out... Yoink!
:;(Obtain {{Item|Goddess's Manuscript (I)}})
----
;(Approach the marked area)
:{{A|vo kwq001 13 chiefdetective 01.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' The party finds no pedestal in which to place the great clockwork key, only a locked door.
:{{A|vo kwq001 13 cappet 01.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' Where's your clan's pedestal? Lemme guess, you hid it away in advance to save yourself the embarrassment of having it exposed as a fake?
:{{A|vo kwq001 13 boborano 01.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' You done? Okay. Now, since my clan's main claim to fame is&mdash;
:{{A|vo kwq001 13 cappet 02.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' Misinformation, half-truths, and fabrication...
:{{A|vo kwq001 13 boborano 02.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' Oh, shut up, Cappet.
:{{A|vo kwq001 13 together 01.ogg}} '''Albizzi & Narrator:''' Shut up, Cappet.
:{{A|vo kwq001 13 cappet 03.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' I swear, if I wind up dead one day, the murderer was Boborano. Let those be my last words.
:{{A|vo kwq001 13 boborano 03.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' My clan's claim to fame is that we outwitted the dragon of old and stole its treasure. Ergo, all articles of value that we own &mdash; including the pedestal for the clockwork key &mdash; lie behind that door.
:{{A|vo kwq001 13 kirara 01.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' So next step is, open the door?
:{{A|vo kwq001 13 boborano 04.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' Almost. There's one step before that. The door is protected by a smart interrogation system. We have to answer its questions, and if we get them wrong, it will alert law enforcement.
:{{A|vo kwq001 13 paimon 01.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Geez. Well, do you at least know the answers?
:{{A|vo kwq001 13 boborano 05.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' The correction fluid of time has dyed white the pages of the book of wisdom. ...Uh, no. No, I don't know the answers.
:{{A|vo kwq001 13 boborano 06.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' But worry not, I had a quick word with the constabulary in advance. They'll ignore the alarm if we get the questions wrong. So answer without fear.
:'''Door:''' (There is no response from the door, and nothing unusual about it.)
:{{DIcon}} (Knock on the door.)
:{{A|vo kwq001 13 behinddoor 01.ogg}} '''Voice From Behind the Door:''' Question 1: Who is it?
:{{DIcon}} Police, open up!
::{{A|vo kwq001 13 chiefdetective 02a 1.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' ...That's actually quite an amusing approach. It's probably not going to get us anywhere, but I do admire your sense of humor, and your commitment to it.
::{{A|vo kwq001 13 behinddoor 01.ogg}} '''Voice From Behind the Door:''' Question 1: Who is it?
:;(Return to option selection)
:{{DIcon}} We're here for a routine inventory check.
::{{A|vo kwq001 13 chiefdetective 02b 1.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' Ah, what an ingenious idea! Far more intelligent than Boborano's ancestors. But I still recommend against this answer.
::{{A|vo kwq001 13 behinddoor 01.ogg}} '''Voice From Behind the Door:''' Question 1: Who is it?
:;(Return to option selection)
:{{DIcon}} {{Traveler}}-Marquis and {{MC|m=his|f=her}} retinue.
::{{A|vo kwq001 13 kirara 02c 1.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' The Great Youkai, Nekomata-in-Boots!
::{{A|vo kwq001 13 paimon 02c 1.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' And the Trusty Travel-Guide Pixie&mdash; Uhh, travel-guide! Trusty travel-guide.
:;(Continue to the next question)
:{{A|vo kwq001 13 behinddoor 02.ogg}} '''Voice From Behind the Door:''' Question 2: By which virtue did the ancients defeat the dragon?
:{{DIcon}} Courage and strength.
::{{A|vo kwq001 13 chiefdetective 03a 1.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' Oh, no no no, don't say that. Even though the writings you saw do prove that bravery has its uses...
::{{A|vo kwq001 13 albizzi 01a 1.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' Uh, you do realize we can hear everything you're saying, right?
::{{A|vo kwq001 13 chiefdetective 03a 2.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' If you say it out loud, you'll only set those three off arguing again. Thinking it is fine, but please promise me you won't say it.
::{{A|vo kwq001 13 behinddoor 02.ogg}} '''Voice From Behind the Door:''' Question 2: By which virtue did the ancients defeat the dragon?
:;(Return to option selection)
:{{DIcon}} Hard work and wealth.
::{{A|vo kwq001 13 chiefdetective 03b 1.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' ...To be completely honest, "hardwork" is a bit of an alien concept to us here in the Constellation Metropole. We have "hardware," and we have "clockwork," but not "hardwork."
::{{A|vo kwq001 13 behinddoor 02.ogg}} '''Voice From Behind the Door:''' Question 2: By which virtue did the ancients defeat the dragon?
:;(Return to option selection)
:{{DIcon}} Wisdom.
::{{A|vo kwq001 13 cappet 04c 1.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' If this is the right answer, I swear I'll&mdash;
::{{A|vo kwq001 13 behinddoor 03.ogg}} '''Voice From Behind the Door:''' Correct.
::{{A|vo kwq001 13 cappet 04c 2.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' Ugh, a barefaced lie! So low.
:;(Continue to the next question)
:{{A|vo kwq001 13 behinddoor 04.ogg}} '''Voice From Behind the Door:''' Question 3: Which is more real, the fiction of the outside world, or the truth of this world?
:{{DIcon}} I don't know.
::{{A|vo kwq001 13 chiefdetective 04a 1.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' C'mon, you'll have to do better than that, kid. I mean, {{Traveler}}-Marquis. You and your friends are the only ones who know the truth about us.
::{{A|vo kwq001 13 behinddoor 04.ogg}} '''Voice From Behind the Door:''' Question 3: Which is more real, the fiction of the outside world, or the truth of this world?
:;(Return to option selection)
:{{DIcon}} Both are false.
::{{A|vo kwq001 13 chiefdetective 04b 1.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' Please try to avoid being unnecessarily cruel in your response.
::{{A|vo kwq001 13 behinddoor 04.ogg}} '''Voice From Behind the Door:''' Question 3: Which is more real, the fiction of the outside world, or the truth of this world?
:;(Return to option selection)
:{{DIcon}} Perhaps... both are equally real.
::{{A|vo kwq001 13 chiefdetective 04c 1.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' Hear, hear. Who can be sure that the outside world isn't just a dream? And that when the dreamer wakes up, they won't just find themselves inside a novel?
::{{A|vo kwq001 13 chiefdetective 04c 2.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' There is no way to know, therefore both are equally real.
::{{A|vo kwq001 13 behinddoor 05.ogg}} '''Voice From Behind the Door:''' All correct. You may have the key pedestal.
::{{Black Screen|The door opens, and a puff of smoke wafts out.<br>After the smoke clears, the pedestal appears.}}
::{{A|vo kwq001 13 boborano 07.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' {{Traveler}}-Marquis, you know what must be done. Please insert the great clockwork key.
::{{A|vo kwq001 13 boborano 08.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' Oh &mdash; and this is my family crest.

:{{A|vo kwq001 14 chiefdetective 01.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' {{Traveler}}-Marquis draws a design that is practical and aesthetically pleasing in equal measure. One thing it is not, however, is correct.
:{{A|vo kwq001 14 chiefdetective 02.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' I think you should take another look at Boborano's family crest and have another go.

:{{A|vo kwq001 14 chiefdetective 03.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' Are you, uh, gonna try again...?

:{{A|vo kwq001 15 boborano 01.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' Now, let me see what&mdash;
:{{A|vo kwq001 15 cappet 01.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' What elaborate fiction the clan of wisdom was able to conjure up.
:{{A|vo kwq001 15 boborano 02.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' If anyone's listening, I would like to submit these as my last words: "I surrender. I'm the one who murdered Cappet."
::{{Readable|title=Goddess's Manuscript (II)
|text=<!--
-->...<br><!--
-->Wise Antonio, in the basement<br><!--
-->of the crumbling house,<br><!--
-->began reading the ancient book<br><!--
-->he had found. His oil<br><!--
-->lamp shook from time to time<br><!--
-->as the swaying structure above-ground<br><!--
-->collapsed.<br><!--
-->The village was to be symbolically razed<br><!--
-->by the dragon, and he<br><!--
-->had been chosen by the dragon,<br><!--
-->for he had not returned home. But<br><!--
-->Antonio did not care.<br><!--
-->He only wished to study<br><!--
-->the book the old lady had given him<br><!--
-->on the bridge he passed today.<br><!--
-->This book was titled the<br><!--
-->"Radiant{{Obf|1}}C{{Obf|1}}arter," and within<br><!--
-->was re{{Obf|1}}or{{Obf|2}}d all the rules that<br><!--
-->every bei{{Obf|3}}in Simulanka<br><!--
-->must follow. It was written in the language<br><!--
-->of world's creation at the very start,<br><!--
-->and if Antonio was not possessed of<br><!--
-->extraordinary wisdom, and deciphered this<br><!--
-->primordial text, there would have been<br><!--
-->no study to be had.<br><!--
-->This book recorded no solutions<br><!--
-->as to resolving the difficulty<br><!--
-->that Constellation Satellite<br><!--
-->presently faced, nor did it contain<br><!--
-->any hexes that could aid<br><!--
-->Antonio in repairing his own home.<br><!--
-->But he knew<br><!--
-->that wisdom was the mightiest thing<br><!--
-->in the world.<br><!--
-->The morning light shone through<br><!--
-->the ruins of his home, and the neighboring<br><!--
-->blacksmith and chubby chief took<br><!--
-->great pains to get rid of the house's<br><!--
-->wreckage, which blocked the basement hatch.<br><!--
-->With dark circles about his eyes,<br><!--
-->Antonio said to the chubby chief:<br><!--
-->"I shall defeat the dragon.<br><!--
-->I will return soon."<br><!--
-->"Are you sure you're alright?<br><!--
-->You don't look like you got any sleep."<br><!--
-->"Just smoke from the oil lamp.<br><!--
-->Don't worry about it."<br><!--
-->...<br><!--
-->The dragon sat atop a mountain<br><!--
-->of treasures, gazing down<br><!--
-->at insignificant little Antonio walking<br><!--
-->closer. Flames gathered<br><!--
-->in its throat, preparing to burn<br><!--
-->the area one centimeter before him,<br><!--
-->all the better to scare this puny,<br><!--
-->foolish creature away.<br><!--
-->"Halt! I'm a qualified 2nd-class Meister!<br><!--
-->The 'Radiant Charter' states that<br><!--
-->should I refuse a duel, you cannot<br><!--
-->use force."<br><!--
-->This restriction did indeed exist,<br><!--
-->and so the wicked dragon<br><!--
-->swallowed its flames whole &mdash; ah, how it<br><!--
-->dreaded going to the toilet tomorrow.<br><!--
-->Antonio, for his part, had not expected<br><!--
-->that the 2nd-class<br><!--
-->rust-clearing Meister qualification exam he<br><!--
-->had taken on a lark would come in useful.<br><!--
-->"And since I am a 2nd-class<br><!--
-->Meister, I propose<br><!--
-->a duel of riddles. You cannot refuse!"<br><!--
-->Now, Simulanka had just such a law, mainly<br><!--
-->for the benefit of sphinxes, old sages, and<br><!--
-->princesses who wished to make life hard for<br><!--
-->others. The evil dragon had not expected<br><!--
-->this rule to catch up with it.<br><!--
-->"I shall ask the first question:<br><!--
-->My house sold for 8,000 Mora yesterday<br><!--
-->But I thought there was room<br><!--
-->to raise the price, so I<br><!--
-->bought it back for 9,000,<br><!--
-->planning to sell it for 10,000.<br><!--
-->How much Mora did I lose in the end?"<br><!--
-->The dragon laughed in contempt.<br><!--
-->"What's so hard about that?<br><!--
-->You could have waited until<br><!--
-->it hit 10,000 to make your move,<br><!--
-->But you sold for 8,<br><!--
-->and bought for 9, so you<br><!--
-->lost 1,000 Mora, that you<br><!--
-->could have earned instead!"<br><!--
-->"Wrong. You burned my house<br><!--
-->down yesterday, and I couldn't<br><!--
-->sell it in time, so I've lost far more."<br><!--
-->"S&mdash;Sorry. I mean,<br><!--
-->I do have to burn a house, and you<br><!--
-->happened not to be home,<br><!--
-->so I might as well hit one that doesn't<br><!--
-->result in any loss of life."<br><!--
-->"Now that you've lost this<br><!--
-->contest, I have the right<br><!--
-->to loot of the same value<br><!--
-->as your life, minus 1 Mora.<br><!--
-->And considering that<br><!--
-->you've burned my house, I can<br><!--
-->seek damages. Let's assume that<br><!--
-->my house is worth just 1 Mora...<br><!--
-->Well, then, wicked dragon,<br><!--
-->you know what to do with yourself."<br><!--
-->"P&mdash;Please spare me. I'll give you<br><!--
-->anything!"<br><!--
-->"Your words, not mine," Antonio said<br><!--
-->as he pulled out a contract<br><!--
-->he had written long ago.<br><!--
-->...<br><!--
-->Thus did Antonio use his<br><!--
-->wisdom to take all the evil<br><!--
-->dragon's treasures.<br><!--
-->The dragon, devastated, would never<br><!--
-->again return to attack<br><!--
-->Constellation Satellite,<br><!--
-->where Antonio lived.<br><!--
-->Many years later, a child asked Antonio:<br><!--
-->"You sold your place for 8,000<br><!--
-->and spent 9,000 buying it back,<br><!--
-->so it looks like you actually<br><!--
-->did lose 1,000 Mora?"<br><br><!--
-->A.A.}}
:{{A|vo kwq001 15 boborano 03.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' Haha, look! Look, my clan's history is true as well. There's that same unforgeable signature again, right here!
:{{A|vo kwq001 15 cappet 02.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' What!?
:{{A|vo kwq001 15 albizzi 01.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' Does this mean that my clan is the only odd one out...?
:{{A|vo kwq001 15 boborano 04.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' Given that my clan's wisdom is such a subject of ridicule in your eyes, I will now appeal to my own personal intelligence &mdash; which I believe far surpasses that of my clan at large &mdash; and make a prediction:
:{{A|vo kwq001 15 boborano 05.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' It seems likely that the claims made by each of our clans regarding their history and virtue are all true.
:{{A|vo kwq001 15 albizzi 02.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' Boborano... How can that be?
:{{A|vo kwq001 15 kirara 01.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' Ah, I get what's going on. Once when I was drinking with [[Yae Miko|Guuji Yae]], she bet me a round of Dried Fish that I couldn't guess which cup the Umeboshi was under.
:{{A|vo kwq001 15 kirara 02.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' Whichever one I guessed, I was always wrong, and Guuji Yae would lift a different cup to reveal the Umeboshi.
:{{A|vo kwq001 15 kirara 03.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' But then I learned later from one of the shrine maidens, [[Miyuki]], that all of the cups had an Umeboshi under them! *sigh*... Just goes to show, I still got a long way to go before I become a great youkai.
:{{A|vo kwq001 15 paimon 01.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Don't mind fox lady, that's just her way of teasing you!
:{{A|vo kwq001 15 boborano 06.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' Oh! Actually, that reminds me. We can now open these three treasure chests. And unlike the guessing game you mentioned, this one's not a trick...
:{{A|vo kwq001 15 albizzi 03.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' Cool... Well, once you've plundered the last of Boborano's family wealth, we can go to my clan's place.

;(After the cutscene)
:{{A|vo kwq001 15 kirara 04.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' Guess I'll take the clockwork key again then? Yoink!
:;(Obtain {{Item|Goddess's Manuscript (II)}})
----
;(Approach Albizzi's clan's sacred site prior to this quest step)
:{{DIcon|Idle}} '''Giant Guard A & B:''' Please do not enter without permission.

;(Attempt to enter the sacred site prior to this quest step)
:{{Black Screen|"Those without appointments may not enter."<br>The giant guards scoop you all up and gently places you outside.<br>The whole process is extremely civilized.}}

;(Along the path towards Albizzi's clan's sacred site)
:{{DIcon|Idle}} '''Red Toy Figure:''' So many Giant Guards...
:{{DIcon|Idle}} '''Red Toy Figure:''' They'll kick everyone out...

;(Approach the marked location)
:{{A|vo kwq001 16 chiefdetective 01.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' The cohort of truth-seekers followed Albizzi to his clan's sacred site. They arrived to the sight of a giant guard towering over them.
:{{A|vo kwq001 16 albizzi 01.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' Up ahead is my clan's gigantified guard. He can be a little pig-headed, and he's incredibly strong. Your weapons won't even scratch him.
:{{A|vo kwq001 16 kirara 01.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' Wait, but wasn't Cappet's clan the one that's all about strength? So... What do you guys believe in then?
:{{A|vo kwq001 16 albizzi 02.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' Oh, the guard is one of Cappet's people. Size is a coveted trait in the clan of strength, after all.
:{{A|vo kwq001 16 albizzi 03.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' Mine is the clan of empathy, and our key contribution is... growth serum!
:{{A|vo kwq001 16 kirara 02.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' ...What's empathetic about that?
:{{A|vo kwq001 16 albizzi 04.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' Our ancestors believed that, just maybe, the dragon of old didn't mean us any harm at all. Perhaps the dragon simply didn't notice us, since we are so very tiny.
:{{A|vo kwq001 16 albizzi 05.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' So they drank the growth serum, and grew even larger than the dragon. Then, they sat the dragon down, calmly explained their perspective, and eventually taught it how to empathize.
:{{A|vo kwq001 16 kirara 03.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' Uhhh...
:{{A|vo kwq001 16 albizzi 06.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' The serum isn't what it once was, though. Nowadays, it doesn't make you grow all that much, and it actually makes you lose your empathy... So, I advise we take a detour.

;(After the cutscene)
:{{A|vo kwq001 17 chiefdetective 01.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' Despite Albizzi's words of caution, somebody, no doubt, has other ideas. "Surely we could avoid a conflict with the guard," they think to themselves, "if we could just try to understand one another."
:{{A|vo kwq001 17 chiefdetective 02.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' You could, of course, just take {{Color|buzzword|the path to your left}} and go around. But some people are gluttons for punishment. It's all part of the experience, I suppose.

;(Approach the base through the front)<!--or approach the front from the inside--><!--can be triggered multiple times-->
:{{A|vo kwq001 17 albizzi 01.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' Everyone, I have returned. I come with the long-awaited Marquis and their followers to search for the lost origins of our clan!
:{{A|vo kwq001 17 giantguard 01.ogg}} '''Giant Guard:''' Well, we weren't told anything about that this morning. Get out of here. Leave us alone.
:{{Black Screen|The giant guards scoop you all up and throws you outside.<br>No one is able to fight back.}}

;(After failing to enter base through the front)<!--can be triggered multiple times-->
:{{A|vo kwq001 17 chiefdetective 03.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' You and Albizzi only wanted to strike up a conversation with the guard. But since greeting you wasn't one of the items included in today's schedule, the relationship quickly soured.
:{{A|vo kwq001 17 chiefdetective 04.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' If you're just looking for a way in, why not consider taking {{Color|buzzword|the path on your left}}?

;(Take the path on the left)
:{{A|vo kwq001 17 albizzi 02.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' Why is my own clan treating me like a villain?
:{{A|vo kwq001 17 cappet 01.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' You've been away too long. We all have. It feels like we've been waiting forever.

;(If the player approaches the key base area without taking the left path)
:{{A|vo kwq001 17 chiefdetective 05.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' Determined, presumably, to always do what is right and never do what is not right... the Marquis refused to take the path on the left.
:{{A|vo kwq001 17 chiefdetective 06.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' Oh, I guess that's one way of doing it... Well, an open world comes with open-ended problems, after all.

;(Approach the key base)
:{{A|vo kwq001 19 albizzi 01.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' We should be getting close.
:{{A|vo kwq001 19 kirara 01.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' Why is this place so full of junk? Are you the kind of people who never throw away the box when you buy something, 'cause you're worried you won't be able to return it without the original packaging?
:{{A|vo kwq001 19 kirara 02.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' We'll never find the Oracle Pillars in all this mess!
:{{A|vo kwq001 19 albizzi 02.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' Never mind that, we have a more pressing issue... It seems there's a slight problem with my clan's family crest. The Marquis may need to utilize their wisdom to solve the issue.
::{{Readable|title=Shape of Empathy
|text=[[File:Shape of Empathy.png|300px]]}}
:{{A|vo kwq001 19 boborano 01.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' Wisdom too, huh? Well, you guys have a bit of everything, don't you? Except empathy.

;(After the cutscene)
:{{DIcon|Idle}} '''Albizzi:''' I'm not hiding, I'm just looking for clues...
:{{DIcon|Idle}} '''Boborano:''' I'm hiding...
:{{DIcon|Idle}} '''Cappet:''' He's got no guts.

;(Approach the key base)
:{{A|vo kwq001 19 kirara 03.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' Over here! I found it!

;(Break crates and vases in front of Kirara, optional)
:{{A|vo kwq001 19 kirara 05.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' Aah! Keep the noise down, we don't wanna alert the guard!

;(Break more crates and vases, optional)<!--which?-->
:{{A|vo kwq001 19 cappet 01.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' Can't you destroy the boxes a little more quietly?

;(Approach the guards, optional)
:{{A|vo kwq001 19 chiefdetective 01.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' You think it's a little impolite to sneak in without saying hello, and decide to introduce yourself. Very courteous of you!
:{{A|vo kwq001 19 kirara 06.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' Oh no, he's gonna find us! Meeeow!

;(After being caught by the guards, optional)<!--or try to enter from the front--><!--can be triggered multiple times-->
:{{A|vo kwq001 19 giantguard 01.ogg}} '''Giant Guard:''' Thank you for being honest and surrendering willingly. Now, we will politely escort you out of the restricted area.
:{{Black Screen|The giant guards scoop you all up and gently places you outside.<br>The whole process is extremely civilized.}}

;(After being thrown out)<!--can be triggered multiple times--><!--doesn't seem to trigger for getting thrown out by Winston-->
:{{A|vo kwq001 19 chiefdetective 03.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' Now that all the pleasantries are out of the way &mdash; time to find a way back in.

;(Knock on the door, optional)
:{{DIcon|Idle}} '''Door:''' ...
:{{DIcon}} Knock on Door
:{{A|vo kwq001 19 albizzi 03.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' This is the guards' headquarters. If we can just explain the situation, I'm sure the giant guard will be less hostile towards us.
:{{DIcon}} Hello...
:{{A|vo kwq001 19 winston 01.ogg}} '''Voice From Behind the Door:''' What are you doing? I'm busy reminiscing about old times with a photo of my friend.
:{{A|vo kwq001 19 albizzi 04.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' I know that voice. Is that Winston?
:{{A|vo kwq001 19 winston 02.ogg}} '''Winston:''' Hahaha, so, you come crawling back... I told you, I am your only friend in this world. What were you thinking, running off on a mission with two complete strangers?
:{{A|vo kwq001 19 winston 03.ogg}} '''Winston:''' You were so naive. "Oh, I'll make friends with them, I know I will!" But in the end, I alone am waiting for you. I alone am your friend.
:{{A|vo kwq001 19 albizzi 05a.ogg}} {{A|vo kwq001 19 albizzi 05b.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' That's not true... It's not just those two. There's {{Traveler}}-Marquis and {{MC|m=his|f=her}} companion, too.
:{{A|vo kwq001 19 winston 04.ogg}} '''Winston:''' ...You made other friends behind my back!? Well, look at you, Albizzi, all grown up... That's the last straw. Get out of here! I never want to see your face again!
:{{A|vo kwq001 19 albizzi 06.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' Actually, no. Why don't you lift the emergency measures for a second and let me in? I have a VIP with me and we're very close to solving the mystery of our sacred site.
:{{A|vo kwq001 19 winston 05.ogg}} '''Winston:''' I said, get out!!!
:{{Black Screen|Winston sounds the alarm. The giant guards arrive, scoop everyone up, and place you outside.<br>"You and Winston both need your own space right now. Your friendship needs a cooling-off period."<br>The guards kindly offer relationship advice.<br>The whole process is unusually civilized.}}

;(Approach to the key base after being thrown out)
:{{Black Screen|...But anyway, then you sneak back in again.}}

;(Insert the Great Clockwork Key)

;(After raising the Oracle Pillars)
:{{A|vo kwq001 19 kirara 04.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' I'll, uh... I'll go keep watch!

:{{A|vo kwq001 19 chiefdetective 02.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' Apparently, that was incorrect. But don't blame yourself, it's Albizzi's clan's fault for taking terrible care of their family crest. How could they let something so important get so dirty?

:{{A|vo kwq001 20 albizzi 01.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' This is the last one.
::{{Readable|title=Goddess's Manuscript (III)
|text=<!--
-->...<br><!--
-->Galileo and Alberto did many good deeds<br><!--
-->again today. Though it was most tiring<br><!--
-->to help the old lady on the bridge<br><!--
-->move her barrels of hard apple cider,<br><!--
-->they each got a small barrel as their<br><!--
-->reward.<br><!--
-->The moonlight was unobstructed<br><!--
-->and beautiful, and the two good<br><!--
-->friends climbed up the high wall that had<br><!--
-->been built to stave the evil dragon off.<br><!--
-->Alberto lost the rock-paper-scissors match,<br><!--
-->so he had to hold the barrel of<br><!--
-->cider under the crook of his arm<br><!--
-->as they climbed the ladder.<br><!--
-->"Look, this is the big house<br><!--
-->that our chubby chief was so proud of!<br><!--
-->Doesn't look so big from here, huh?"<br><!--
-->said Alberto<br><!--
-->as he looked at the house.<br><!--
-->"You're wrong. That's my home,"<br><!--
-->said Galileo.<br><!--
-->"The chief's house is that one."<br><!--
-->Alberto's night vision was not all<br><!--
-->that good, and moonlight<br><!--
-->could never compare to daylight.<br><!--
-->If one were to close one's eyes,<br><!--
-->the light could not be seen at all.<br><!--
-->He tried a little harder, but<br><!--
-->could discern nothing more.<br><!--
-->"But it's also really small,"<br><!--
-->Galileo continued, "so there's<br><!--
-->nothing wrong with your statement."<br><!--
-->Galileo and Alberto were both<br><!--
-->rather perceptive<br><!--
-->people. Galileo's reply covered<br><!--
-->for Alberto's<br><!--
-->{{sic|ciscomfort}} regarding his poor vision,<br><!--
-->while Alberto also lost<br><!--
-->the rock-paper-scissors match on purpose,<br><!--
-->so that he could carry<br><!--
-->the cider barrel, because<br><!--
-->the gears under Galileo's ribs<br><!--
-->were injured.<br><!--
-->"Here's to you."<br><!--
-->The two friends raised a toast<br><!--
-->once Alberto stuffed a cork<br><!--
-->back into the barrel.<br><br><!--
-->The next day, the two<br><!--
-->gathered everyone in the village<br><!--
-->plaza.<br><!--
-->First, they apologized for the collapse<br><!--
-->of the anti-dragon wall, and told<br><!--
-->all the people that they were preparing<br><!--
-->to have a talk with the evil dragon.<br><!--
-->"I know it was a lot of work for<br><!--
-->everyone to fix that wall, but we're<br><!--
-->not that fussed about it anyway,"<br><!--
-->the chubby chief said, "but are you<br><!--
-->sure you're not bragging when you say<br><!--
-->you knocked it down yourselves?"<br><!--
-->Of course, that was not the chief's point.<br><!--
-->He too was a good<br><!--
-->person. He continued, "Also,<br><!--
-->it's too dangerous<br><!--
-->to seek the dragon out."<br><!--
-->"Don't worry about us."<br><!--
-->And so, the two best friends<br><!--
-->in the whole world departed.<br><br><!--
-->The evil dragon trembled<br><!--
-->before Alberto and Galileo.<br><!--
-->For some reason, the old lady's liquor<br><!--
-->could make people<br><!--
-->grow very, very large.<br><!--
-->That was how they accidentally squashed<br><!--
-->the high walls the previous night.<br><!--
-->As they gazed down at the ground far below,<br><!--
-->they more or less understood<br><!--
-->how the dragon thought.<br><!--
-->No wonder it could accidentally<br><!--
-->destroy the village at its feet. So<br><!--
-->as long as they could<br><!--
-->get the dragon to notice<br><!--
-->people, they could surely<br><!--
-->come to an understanding.<br><!--
-->The two friends thus drank<br><!--
-->all the remaining magic cider, becoming<br><!--
-->even larger than the dragon<br><!--
-->by a good margin.<br><!--
-->Reeking of alcohol, they sandwiched<br><!--
-->the dragon between them, and drunkenly<br><!--
-->tried reas{{Obf|1}}ni{{Obf|1}}g with it.<br><!--
-->The drag{{Obf|1}}n {{Obf|2}}riveled up in terror,<br><!--
-->all of its m{{Obf|3}}sty and fell aura<br><!--
-->forever gone, indeed,<br><!--
-->it even looked kind of pitiful.<br><!--
-->Alberto attempted to pick dirt<br><!--
-->off the scales on the dragon's back,<br><!--
-->but wound up picking off an entire scale.<br><!--
-->The dragon sought to flee,<br><!--
-->But Galileo, fearing that the crisis might<br><!--
-->persist for ten thousand years more<br><!--
-->if the misunderstanding was not cleared up,<br><!--
-->tugged its tail and dragged it right back.<br><!--
-->"To be honest, we've always lived<br><!--
-->under your feet, but we<br><!--
-->are far too small, so you may not have ever<br><!--
-->seen us. Now, we've transformed and<br><!--
-->become *burp* big." Galileo said, "So now,<br><!--
-->surely, you must know<br><!--
-->that we dwell at your feet."<br><!--
-->The dragon nodded repeatedly.<br><!--
-->And thus did the two and the dragon<br><!--
-->chat all night, and believing<br><!--
-->the goal of mutual understanding<br><!--
-->achieved, the two set off<br><!--

:{{A|vo kwq001 20 albizzi 02.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' The signature! ...So it's true! Empathy is one of the founding virtues of Constellation Metropole too!
:{{A|vo kwq001 20 boborano 01.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' Just as we suspected. All three are the truth.
:{{A|vo kwq001 20 cappet 01.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' Okay, well this is a lot to process. I feel a little empty inside... Yes, we found the truth, but... there's too much truth.
:{{A|vo kwq001 20 kirara 01.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' I get you. It's like... in [[Inazuma]], when there were only six books in the Mirage Warriors series, it was really popular.
:{{A|vo kwq001 20 kirara 02.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' But by the time book number eighty-eight came out, nobody wanted to read it. They'd all lost interest.
:{{A|vo kwq001 20 chiefdetective 01.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' A brief moment of joy is drowned out by a growing feeling of melancholy. But perhaps there is a glimmer of hope to be found, too?
:{{A|vo kwq001 20 chiefdetective 02.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' Anyone? Anyone? Alright, I'll say it: How is it the case that these three versions of history can all be true at once?
:{{A|vo kwq001 20 paimon 01.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' That's exactly what Paimon was wondering... But Boborano kind of already explained it away earlier.
:{{A|vo kwq001 20 paimon 02.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' So Paimon was worried she'd look stupid for asking the question.
:{{A|vo kwq001 20 boborano 02.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' It's not a stupid question at all, my dear little pixie. While I did postulate that different truths may coexist, there is an issue when it comes to these three truths in particular.
:{{A|vo kwq001 20 boborano 03.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' The problem is, all three truths are the history of the exact same thing &mdash; namely, the dragon and the Metropole's origins. Yet all three bear the signature, showing that they're genuine.
:;(A toy figure rings the bell in the nearby bell tower)
:{{A|vo kwq001 20 chiefdetective 03.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' Suddenly, the sound of a bell rings out!
:;(Obtain {{Item|Goddess's Manuscript (III)}})

<!--
(Challenge)
Get out of here!
Flee and reach the designated location: 0/1
Lose the Giant Guard
-->
;(After the cutscene)
:{{A|vo kwq001 21 giantguard 01.ogg}} '''Giant Guard:''' The bell! It rang once, what does that mean, again...? Ah yes, highest level of emergency! Everyone, to the main entrance, stat! Bring all the glue traps and place them outside the gates!
:{{A|vo kwq001 21 chiefdetective 01.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' The whole city is on the lookout, and there's only one way out. It's the path right in front of you.
:{{A|vo kwq001 21 cappet 01.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' Why did they ring the bell, anyway? Also, why is one ring the highest level of emergency?
:{{A|vo kwq001 21 albizzi 01.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' Obviously because you have to respond fast when it's an emergency. It'd be a bit too late if they waited till the ninety-ninth ring.

;(If the player is caught by the guards)
:{{A|vo kwq001 21 giantguard 02.ogg}} '''Giant Guard:''' Suspicious individuals detected! I don't know what law you've broken, but we're currently at the highest level of alert. Come with us, turn yourselves in!
:{{Black Screen|Everyone scatters. You hear Cappet's voice shouting out, "It's every man for himself!"<br>After the guards have gone, you regroup back at the same place. It looks like no one was caught...}}
:{{A|vo kwq001 21 chiefdetective 02.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' Let's try that again, shall we?

;(Reach the outside of the main entrance)
:{{Black Screen|The guards charge toward the main entrance...}}
:{{A|vo kwq001 21 giantguard 03.ogg}} '''Giant Guard:''' They're outside! After them!

;(If the player is caught by the Giant Guard)
:{{A|vo kwq001 21 giantguard 04.ogg}} '''Giant Guard:''' Arrest these suspicious individuals, and their associate Albizzi! You're coming with me!

;(When the Giant Guard reaches the wooden fence without catching the player)<!--even if the Giant Guard runs ahead of the player-->
:{{A|vo kwq001 21 giantguard 05.ogg}} '''Giant Guard:''' Any further, and we'll be outside our jurisdiction... I think we've pursued them far enough to earn a salary from the empathy clan. Come on, let's head back.

;(Approach the designated location)
:{{A|vo kwq001 22 kirara 01.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' Phew, we made it out. Dunno if we'll still be needing this clockwork key, but I yoinked it out before we ran, just in case!
:{{A|vo kwq001 22 paimon 01.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Okay, but back to the truth problem. There are three conflicting versions of the truth, and somehow they're all still true. What is that supposed to mean?
:{{A|vo kwq001 22 boborano 01.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' I don't know. I doubt anyone here in Simulanka could make sense of it. All we do know is that any manuscript bearing her signature has to be valid.
:{{A|vo kwq001 22 cappet 01.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' She is the Goddess of Fate, the creator of all of this. And all these manuscripts are her grand design.
:{{A|vo kwq001 22 albizzi 01.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' The reason we argued about who was right was that we didn't know enough about the truth of the past. But now we have the truth, so we just have to accept it.
:{{A|vo kwq001 22 albizzi 02.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' As surely as we will follow the clockwork path designed for us, so is this the course that history has taken. It is clear and incontrovertible.
:{{A|vo kwq001 22 boborano 02.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' We will never argue again. Thank you all.
:{{A|vo kwq001 22 chiefdetective 01.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' Is that all there is to it? Is this where the decision made at the first crossroads of destiny has led us to? A pointlessly happy ending?
:{{A|vo kwq001 22 chiefdetective 02.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' Eh, overthinking it would be equally pointless. Well, that's enough for one day &mdash; time to take a break.

:{{A|vo kwq001 22 boborano 03.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' Whatever happens, today was a breakthrough in my journey of discovery. I will go back and share it with my clan.

:{{A|vo kwq001 22 albizzi 03.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' And me.
:{{A|vo kwq001 22 kirara 02.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' Let's leave it there for today then. I'm sure we'll find out what else Mr. Narrator has planned for us tomorrow.

:{{A|vo kwq001 24 detectivetough 01.ogg}} '''Detective-Looking Dude:''' Last words? What did he say?

:{{A|vo kwq001 24 detectivetough 02.ogg}} '''Detective:''' Don't worry, Boborano. I don't consider you a suspect, nor do I have the authority to charge anyone with a crime. So, are you the last people to have had contact with him?
:{{DIcon}} Y&mdash;Yes...

:{{A|vo kwq001 24 detectivetough 04.ogg}} '''Detective:''' I know. It's despicable. Hitting someone in the back of the head is the second-worst act of cruelty there is. The first being replacing their gear oil with extra-strong glue.

:{{A|vo kwq001 24 detectivetough 06.ogg}} '''Detective:''' Wait, but... Surely you can't be suggesting that just because Cappet isn't broken, there's no need to go looking for the culprit...?

:{{A|vo kwq001 24 detectivetough 07.ogg}} '''Detective:''' ...Unfortunately, this is rapidly turning into a cold case. There's no evidence, and no witnesses. Unless there's an official clockwork pedestal of the Goddess of Prophecy around here somewhere...
:{{A|vo kwq001 24 detectivetough 08.ogg}} '''Detective:''' *cough* *cough* ...Ahem, excuse me.
:{{A|vo kwq001 24 chiefdetective 01.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' Then, suddenly, the long-lost dragon of old flew across the sky!

:{{A|vo kwq001 24 boborano 03.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' I didn't see anything... Wait, why can't I move?
:{{A|vo kwq001 24 chiefdetective 02.ogg}} '''Narrator:''' My mistake, it was just a cloud. Or a bird, or something.
:{{A|vo kwq001 24 detectivetough 09.ogg}} '''Detective:''' If only we could turn time backwards and replay the crime.

;(After catching up to the detective)
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 kirara 01.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' You've got nowhere left to run!
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 detectivereal 01.ogg}} '''Detective:''' Alright, I confess.
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 paimon 01.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' That was fast!
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 detectivereal 02.ogg}} '''Detective:''' Getting caught by you here was a backup plan. I don't know if what I've done will make things better or not.
:;(The detective's title changes from Chief Consulting Detective to Narrator)
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 detectivereal 03.ogg}} '''Detective:''' Time to come clean. I am the narrator, the one who's been guiding you all this time.
:{{DIcon}} Yeah, I figured...
::{{A|vo kwq001 36 detectivereal 04a 1.ogg}} '''Detective:''' Hahaha, okay. I guess my voice-acting skills have some room for improvement.
:{{DIcon}} Gasp! Shock! My mind is blown!
::{{A|vo kwq001 36 detectivereal 04b 1.ogg}} '''Detective:''' You're overdoing it a little bit there.
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 detectivereal 05.ogg}} '''Detective:''' Anyway, I only did what I did because&mdash;
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 paimon 02.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Why are you suddenly spilling the beans?
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 detectivereal 06.ogg}} '''Detective:''' I poured my heart and soul into all this. I was worried you wouldn't ask.
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 detectivereal 07.ogg}} '''Detective:''' The truth is, I was one of the first conscious beings ever made by the Goddess of Creation. And I've known for a long time that this whole world is just a fairytale, written by the Goddess of Fate.
:{{DIcon}} ...!
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 detectivereal 08.ogg}} '''Detective:''' I know they say that fairytales are just made up for kids to read. But I refuse to believe that fairytales are just fictional stories, and nothing more.
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 detectivereal 09.ogg}} '''Detective:''' The reason why Constellation Metropole has three origin stories is that the Goddess of Fate wrote three drafts, and couldn't decide which one she liked best.
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 detectivereal 10.ogg}} '''Detective:''' Then, her cat trod all over them and they all got crumpled together. So the three worlds just sort of folded into one.
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 detectivereal 11.ogg}} '''Detective:''' The Goddess of Fate was torn between them anyway, since she couldn't decide which ending was best for the dragon or the kids.
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 detectivereal 12.ogg}} '''Detective:''' So when she saw what the cat had done, she simply decided to go with all three.
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 paimon 03.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Who'd have thought... But what does any of this have to do with what you did?
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 detectivereal 13.ogg}} '''Detective:''' You're not a fictional character, so you couldn't hope to understand my sorrow. Honestly, I don't think there's anyone in all of Simulanka who would understand.
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 detectivereal 14.ogg}} '''Detective:''' Every day that I experience, every interaction I have with another person... Is it really all just a work of fiction?
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 detectivereal 15.ogg}} '''Detective:''' The only reason the three great clans wanted to find out the truth was for the pointless task of electing the Supreme Clan. I thought that once they'd learned the truth, it might make them curious enough to investigate further.
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 detectivereal 16.ogg}} '''Detective:''' But as it turned out, they just... accepted it. And carried on living the same old lives.
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 detectivereal 17.ogg}} '''Detective:''' I have to motivate them to keep looking for answers, now that they think they've learned the truth. I have to make them uncomfortable with the superficial explanation that they took at face value.
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 detectivereal 18.ogg}} '''Detective:''' And I have to figure out, once and for all, while you real people from the outside world are still here: Are we real?
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 paimon 04.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Aw...
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 detectivereal 19.ogg}} '''Detective:''' That's my full confession. Time for you to take me back. I'm guessing I'll probably be forced to make a public apology, then sentenced to half a day in solitary confinement. I definitely deserve half a day.
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 detectivereal 20.ogg}} '''Detective:''' Oh, also, pass this message onto Cappet, Boborano, and Albizzi, if you could: The great clockwork key was originally put in place jointly by the ancestors of the three clans.
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 detectivereal 21.ogg}} '''Detective:''' If the three of them had had any ability to cooperate whatsoever, they'd have been able to remove it by themselves.
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 detectivereal 22.ogg}} '''Detective:''' Over all these years, not once have they ever tried removing it together.
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 m 01.ogg}} '''{{tt|???|???}}:''' Oh, my poor child. There's one thing you've been mistaken about this whole time.
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 kirara 02.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' Aah! Whose voice is that!? ...Detective, was that you? Your voice acting's actually pretty good.
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 m 02.ogg}} '''???:''' The reason fairytales are suitable for children is that they help them to understand the world.
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 m 03.ogg}} '''???:''' Fairytales may be works of fiction, but at their heart lies an internal logic that is undoubtedly real-world truth in a condensed form. Perhaps they simplify good and evil, and perhaps they hide the darkness in metaphors.
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 m 04.ogg}} '''???:''' But let there be no doubt: The world within fairytales is as real as can be. And by extension, you and your compatriots are also real.
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 detectivereal 23.ogg}} '''Detective:''' Goddess! Is it really you!?
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 m 05.ogg}} '''{{tt|Footnote|Echo of the Goddess of Fate}}:''' The line that separates footnotes from narrative can never be crossed. Never the two shall meet. This is why you have never heard my voice before.
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 m 06.ogg}} '''Footnote:''' But now, you wish to break free from the story &mdash; and there's a cat nearby &mdash; so you can hear my echo.
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 kirara 03.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' Nekomata...
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 detectivereal 24.ogg}} '''Detective:''' ...Just your echo...?
:'''Detective:''' ...
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 paimon 05.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Aw... Poor detective...
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 detectivereal 25.ogg}} '''Detective:''' So... we are a part of the real world, too...
:{{Black Screen|You lead the surrendered detective back to Cappet...}}

But no smiling from the victim or their friends and family, thank you. No no, don't get up! Stay on the ground, we need to capture the crime-scene as-is!"<br><br>"3, 2, 1, say cheeeeese!"}}
