:'''{{Traveler}}:''' (Weirdest photo experience of my life...)
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 cappet 01.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' My head's spinning. Albizzi just gave me a quick rundown of the situation. So you caught the detective?
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 paimon 06.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Sorta, we chased him until he surrendered. Oh, and he asked us to pass on a message...
:{{Black Screen|You tell the three about the rest of what happened...}}
:{{Black Screen|...And that they could have removed the great clockwork key if they'd just worked together.}}
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 cappet 02.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' Does he really think we didn't try that? 'Cause we did. After six months in that place.
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 boborano 01.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' That was my bad. I thought it was a stupid idea at the time, so I didn't really exert myself.
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 albizzi 01.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' I, uh... I also sort of stopped trying after three years.
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 cappet 03.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' You...! *sigh* Never mind, I'm partly to blame as well. On the second attempt, I just hugged the key and pretended like I was pulling as hard as I could.
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 kirara 04.ogg}} '''Kirara:''' You guys are so lazy... My granny's neighbor's pet {{sic|dog|nolink=1|expected=cat<!--audio mismatch-->}} has nothing on you, and it spends all day every day sunbathing.
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 cappet 04.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' Anyway, you said you heard the voice of the Goddess of Fate at the end? That's amazing.
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 albizzi 02.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' There is a world beyond our own after all.
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 cappet 05.ogg}} '''Cappet:''' What would you guys say to taking a trip to the outside world some time? Otherwise, I got bashed in the back of the head for nothing.
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 boborano 02.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' Depends, do either of you know how to get there...? But yes, I agree, we should go. And not invite the detective, just to annoy him.
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 boborano 03.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' But maybe the reason we never worried about whether we're real or not is that, unlike him, we weren't there to witness the creation of this world. We've never had any reason to doubt that we're real.
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 boborano 04.ogg}} '''Boborano:''' If someone ever convinced me that these delightful dimwits, Cappet and Albizzi, weren't real... I'd be devastated.
:{{A|vo kwq001 36 albizzi 03.ogg}} '''Albizzi:''' Hehe.
{{Dialogue End}}

==Trivia==
* The following lines are in rhyming {{w|iambic pentameter}}:
{{Dialogue Start}}
::'''Albizzi:''' *clears throat* So many summers, winters, springs, and falls, and now at last a hero hither strides.
::'''Boborano:''' This realm knows not what lies beyond its walls, its secrets mystify the world outside.

::'''Boborano:''' As golden sunlight fills the firmament, the tabletop engrosses your attent. Perhaps, perchance, peruse these pages thence  they surely represent no ill intent.

::'''Albizzi:''' With wood and earthen wares strewn all around, the demon-feline's fury can't be quelled, reducing them to rubble on the ground, she finds the vessels vacant save for... uhh, air?
::'''Boborano:''' She finds long gone the gems that once they held.

::'''Boborano:''' The weary heroes falter in their quest, for home they long, for friend and kin they yearn. These thoughts in mind, they pause and deem it best, to cease this foolish errand, and return

::'''Cappet:''' A sense of longing wells up in the chest, and to one's heart one always must be true. Resume, you must, your once-forsaken quest, and persevere until you see it through.
{{Dialogue End}}
* The blacked-out text likely represents a pawprint from the Goddess of Fate's cat.
** The formation of the blacked-out text is identical across all manuscripts and all languages: two individual characters in the first line, an individual character and two consecutive characters in the next line, and three consecutive characters in the final line, with all blacked-out characters in close proximity to each other and also located in roughly the same section<!-- if you actually go and line count, you are doing god's work --> of each manuscript (around the middle for all languages except for Korean, where the "pawprint" is in the first three lines of each manuscript). The individual blacked-out characters represent the cat's toe pads, meaning the pawprint is "upright" when viewed at a 45-degree angle.
* In the picture at the end of this quest, the Detective holds a sign reading "NARR" (Narrator) in [[Fontaine Script]].
* The story the Narrator tells about a teacher asking the clan members' greatest fears is a reference to the [https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/what-scares-you-the-most What Scares You The Most] meme, specifically the [https://www.reddit.com/r/MemeEconomy/comments/8lwtw5/i_see_a_lot_of_potential_with_this_format/ version made by u/SicWik in r/MemeEconomy] in Reddit.
